intro: Thlaspi peregrinum, commonly known as the alpine pennycress, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often hairy. Thlaspi peregrinum thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. It is often found in meadows and on slopes at high elevations.
